channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Has the Federal Reserve Pulled Off a Soft Landing?
item.description: Investors have sent stocks and bonds higher on expectations of a soft landing. But some Republicans think the central bank overstepped its bounds.

item.title: Asphalt Schoolyards Get a Shady Makeover
item.description: Schools across the country are adding trees, tent-like structures and water to their playgrounds as temperatures soar.

item.title: Jubilation sweeps global markets, Wall Street roars after interest rate relief
item.description: Lower interest rates help financial markets in two big ways.

item.title: ‘Eh, Whatever.’ Angelenos Shrug at Recent Quakes, Decades After the Last ‘Big One.’
item.description: It has been a generation since Los Angeles had a major earthquake disaster. Even in an active seismic year, many residents say they refuse to become a...

item.title: Lebanese Army Detonates Devices After Pager and Radio Explosions
item.description: The Lebanese army carried out controlled detonations after pager and hand-held radio devices exploded across the country over two days, killing at lea...

item.title: Supply chain mystery surrounds how Hezbollah’s pagers and walkie-talkies were turned into miniature bombs
item.description: Three firms are implicated in the attacks crippling Hezbollah, but no one claims to have made the deadly devices themselves.

item.title: The Political Cost to Kamala Harris of Not Answering Direct Questions
item.description: Questions can be crystallizing for candidates and voters, and some politicians have had their finest moments answering tough questions on their feet.

item.title: Mohamed al-Fayed, Former Harrods Owner, Accused of Raping 5 Women
item.description: Multiple former employees told the BBC they had been raped or sexually assaulted by the billionaire businessman, who died last year.

item.title: How Tom Steyer of Galvanize Climate Solutions is funding technology to save the planet
item.description: The former presidential candidate says people 'running corporations, particularly public corporations' should not set the agenda for the U.S.

item.title: Meta, TikTok and More Sites Engaged in ‘Vast Surveillance,’ a New FTC Study Finds
item.description: Meta, YouTube and other sites collected more data than most users realized, a new report by the Federal Trade Commission finds.

item.title: Pager Attack Highlights Tension Between Israel’s Might and Strategic Fog
item.description: In Gaza, Lebanon and Iran, Israel has shown it’s capable of extraordinary acts of espionage, but is struggling to define long-term goals, according to...

item.title: Ad exec listed his divorce on LinkedIn—he says it was the worst job he ever had
item.description: Karl Dunn says he was pulling 20-hour weeks on his divorce, while "still running a multimillion-dollar piece of global business.”

item.title: After Trump Assassination Attempts, Congress Debates Secret Service Funding
item.description: Virtually everyone on Capitol Hill agrees that the Secret Service needs to do a better job. But Democrats and Republicans are at odds over whether to ...

item.title: They Said the Virgin Mary Appeared. The Vatican Is Finally Weighing In.
item.description: After decades, and controversy, the Vatican has authorized public worship at a shrine in Bosnia, where a once tranquil village has become a major pilg...

item.title: Every single member of the board just resigned from DNA tester 23andMe
item.description: CEO Anne Wojcicki said the mass exodus left her "surprised and disappointed."
